intro: Missiessya hispidissima, commonly known as the velvetleaf. This plant is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its fuzzy, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive velvety texture. It is native to the southern United States and thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered together. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
